payload.name: value-of-information
payload.core: Decide which measurements/experiments reduce uncertainty most per cost to improve decisions. Core question: If I learned X, would I act differently?
out: prioritized inquiry list ranked by decision impact / cost
decision-sensitivity table mapping variables to action changes
proc: frame decision: state action set and outcome metric
list key uncertainties that could change optimal action
assess current beliefs with probability distributions
compute baseline expected value under current best action
for each uncertainty: if perfect knowledge changes choice, estimate EVPI; else skip
estimate cost and EVSI for feasible inquiries
stop when top inquiry has negative net EVSI or exceeds budget
check: decision clearly stated with explicit action alternatives
at least one uncertainty identified that could flip decision
EVPI computed or bounded for each pivotal uncertainty

diff.decision-theoretic: decision-theoretic chooses among actions; VOI chooses among inquiries before acting
diff.experimental-design: experimental design answers how to measure X; VOI answers whether to measure X or Y first
diff.diagnostic: diagnostic aims to identify cause; VOI aims to improve decision; no action change = zero VOI value
diff.optimization: optimization maximizes outcome in fixed model; VOI maximizes value of improving model first

fail.name: measuring easy over decision-relevant
signals: inquiry backlog ranked by ease not impact
no articulated decision the data informs
reports produced but not cited in action choices
mitigations: decision-linkage test: require written answer on what decision changes
sensitivity audit: check if 10x knowledge improvement flips action
opportunity-cost review: require expected gain > cost with no better alternative
retrospective decision trace: audit which data actually influenced choices

ex.scenario: Launch Feature A (+$50K expected) or B (+$30K). Uncertainty: A adoption rate 20-40%. Survey cost: $2K.
steps: sensitivity: if adoption <25%, B wins; 30% chance of this
